titleStmt.title: By the Lord Deputy and Council. Tyrconnell. Whereas a proclamation issued from the late lord deputy and councel of this kingdom concerning the weighing of such forreign coyn as hath been made currant here; which proclamation followeth in these words. ...
titleStmt.author: Ireland. Lord Deputy (1687-1689 : Tyrconnel)
Tyrconnel, Richard Talbot, Earl of, 1630-1691.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Andrew Crook and Samuel Helsham, assigns of Benjamin Tooke printer to the Kings most excellent Majesty; and are to be sold by Andrew Crook at his Majesties printing-house on Ormonde-Key, and Samuel Helsham, at the Colledge-Arms in Castle-street,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption and opening lines of text.
"Given at the Council Chamber in Dublin. the 16 Day of January 1687".
Dates are given according to Lady Day dating.
Reissues of proclamation 6 June 1683, No. 926, q.v. which is out of print, and orders it to be observed.
Steele notation: Arms 186. and Councel 2) followeth, 3) Sevil, 4) Forreign 5) do Contrary.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
